1.question: Why is planning ahead important in time management?
options: It guarantees everything will go exactly as planned
It helps reduce stress and gives you a structure to follow
It allows you to multitask better
It eliminates the need to take breaks
1.answer: It helps reduce stress and gives you a structure to follow

1.question: According to the Eisenhower Matrix, what should you do with tasks that are important but not urgent?
What is the Pomodoro Technique?
options: Working nonstop until a task is complete
Scheduling your day hour by hour
Working in 25-minute focused sessions with short breaks
1.answer: Working in 25-minute focused sessions with short breaks

1.question: What is a good way to deal with procrastination?
options: Work only when you feel like it
Break tasks into smaller steps and start with a quick one
1.answer: Break tasks into smaller steps and start with a quick one

1.question: Why is multitasking discouraged in time management?
options: It improves your ability to focus
It helps you finish more tasks at once

2.question: What is a digital footprint?
options: A virus that spreads on social media
The amount of time you spend online
The trail of data you leave behind from your online activity
Your physical location when using the internet
2.answer: The trail of data you leave behind from your online activity

2.question: Who can benefit from buying or accessing your online data?
Which of these is a good way to limit online tracking?
Why should you review app permissions regularly?
options: To make sure apps aren’t accessing more data than they need
2.answer: To make sure apps aren’t accessing more data than they need

2.question: What is the main purpose of third-party cookies?
options: To improve battery life on your device
To track users across multiple websites for advertising
To speed up your internet connection
2.answer: To track users across multiple websites for advertising
